title: Woven Portrait, mid-19th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: jacquard woven: warp-faced plain weave (white) with continuous supplementary weft (black)
dimensions:
Warp x Weft: 44.5 x 34.3 cm (17 1/2 x 13 1/2 in.)
Loom width: 17 1/2 in.
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Small piece of white fabric with two woven pictures in shades of black, white and grays. On top, a portrait of Joseph-Marie Jacquard (1752-1834) after a portrait by Jean-Claude Bonnefond (1796-1860). Below, a picture of a loom with the Jacquard punch-card mechanism. Woven on a loom equipped with a Jacquard mechanism by Carquillat (died 1884).

exhibitions.title: Faster, Cheaper, Newer, More: The Revolutions of 1848

tombstone.epitaph:
Woven Portrait, mid-19th century.
mid-19th century. Medium: silk
